intro: Tripinna africana, commonly known as African tripinna, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, lance-shaped leaves, and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Tripinna africana is often found in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates.
